name: Path N
title: Pathological N
notes:
**Note 1:**  Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in distant metastasis.

**Note 2:**  Regional lymph nodes for any part of the esophagus fall in the range from periesophageal/cervical to the celiac region.  Contralateral and bilateral cervical, supraclavicular, and mediastinal lymph nodes are included.

**Note 3:**  Celiac nodes are coded in regional lymph nodes for lower thoracic (abdominal) esophagus; they are coded in distant metastasis for cervical and intrathoracic (upper and middle) esophagus.  Cervical nodes, NOS are coded in regional lymph nodes for cervical esophagus; they are coded in distant metastasis for upper and lower thoracic (abdominal) esophagus.

**Note 4:**  Lymph node stations/groups are listed in parentheses when applicable.  

**Note 5:**   Regional lymph node involvement is rare for GISTs, so that cases in which the nodal status is not associated clinically or pathologically could be considered N0 instead of NX or pNX
